definition: "The Ugly Duckling" by Hans Christian Andersen 安徒生[An1 tu2 sheng1]
clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°

sentences.english: The little ugly duck murmured while walked, suddenly a courser scurried out.
sentences.chinese: 丑小鸭边走边说，突然，一直猎狗窜了出来。

sentences.english: And he went away without touching the Ugly Duckling.
sentences.chinese: 然后他没有碰丑小鸭一下就走了。

sentences.english: Her ugly-duckling narrative proved irresistible to reality-TV fans.
sentences.chinese: 她丑小鸭般的故事在这现实的电视节目中被验证。

sentences.english: The Ugly Duckling Goes to Work is more entertaining than most books on business.
sentences.chinese: 丑小鸭开始行动比大多数有关商业的书都更有趣。

sentences.english: My sister was an ugly duckling.
sentences.chinese: 我的妹妹以前是个丑小鸭。

sentences.english: My mother once called me an ugly duckling.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈曾经叫我丑小鸭。

sentences.english: The Ugly Duckling also jumped in the water and swam very well.
sentences.chinese: 这只丑小鸭也跳进了水，而且水游的很好。

sentences.english: Finally, the pond froze, and the duckling couldn't move any more.
sentences.chinese: 最后，池塘结冰了，丑小鸭被冻住了。

sentences.english: The butterfly is really among the swan-ugly duckling school of butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 这种蝴蝶可真是蝴蝶家族中丑小鸭变天鹅的一员了。

sentences.english: Ugly is not ugly. He is a very beautiful swan.
sentences.chinese: 丑小鸭一点也不丑，它是一直非常漂亮的小天鹅。

sentences.english: "The ugly duckling can swim very well, " thinks the mother duck.

definition: Wild Swans, family autobiography by British-Chinese writer Jung Chang 張戎|张戎[Zhang1 Rong2]/alternative title 鴻|鸿, after the author's original name 張二鴻|张二鸿[Zhang1 Er4 hong2]
lit. to break through a cocoon and turn into a butterfly (idiom)/fig. to emerge strong after a period of struggle/to get to a better place after going through difficult period
